pages.text:
Welcome to Mystcraft!

There are many worlds waiting to be explored.
To craft books, drop the required items on the ground together.
Some books you cannot craft, and must find in structures.

Books can be opened and the words clicked on to teleport into their dimension. 

When used, books are dropped at their current location.

This book describes the books and dimensions.

Important!

Since books are dropped on use, always bring a way out! This is most commonly a linking book.
For dimension books, it is recommended to use lecterns which can be crafted with a T of slabs in a crafting table.

Linking Book:
Book + Ender Pearl

The most powerful of all books. When used, each link book will teleport back to where it was crafted. These cannot be placed on lecterns. Link books can be renamed in an anvil (remember where they go!)

Sanctuary:
Found in Villages

Sanctuary is a beautiful peaceful world without night or danger. Very nice for building or living in.

Archipelago:
Found in Shipwrecks

This is an island world with hilly islands and swamp. Massive caverns stretch deep underwater.

Wasteland:
Found in Desert Temples

This world is hot and barren, desert stretching endlessly around a large volcano. Most inhabitants head underground to avoid the sun.

Skylands:
Found at Ruined Portals

The skylands exist in an airy void. If you happen to fall out of the Skylands, you will land in the Pocket Dimension.

The Warrens:
Found in Skylands

No explorer has successfully returned from the Warrens. Enter at you own risk.

Pocket Dimension:
Toss Book&Quill into an End Crystal

This dark world has the unique feature of one block in this world being 16 blocks in the overworld, similar to the nether. This makes it easy to travel long distances.

Death Book:
Book + Bone

This book is a one-way ticket back to where the player last died. It is consumed on use and can only be used once per death.

Player Book:
Book + Player Head

If you manage to obtain the head of a player, this powerful book will teleport you directly to them. 
A player head can be obtained if the player is killed by a charged creeper.

Tip on Moving entities:

If you would like to move an animal or mob across dimensions, hold a lead in your offhand (don't use it) when using a dimensional book. The nearest entity within 6 blocks will teleport with you. This does not teleport players or dropped items.
